bibl.title: Administering Dioscorus' Monastery: Evidence in Lists.
bibl.note: Lists of names followed by either a patronymic or a job title. Hypothetically linked by the editor to the Aphrodito region and to the monastery founded by the father of the sixth-century poet-lawyer Dioscorus of Aphrodito, Apollos. Antaiopolite, AD VII.

bibl.title: Inediti offerti a Rosario Pintaudi per il suo 65° compleanno.

bibl.idno: P. Chester Beatty Inv. 66 = P. Pintaudi 23

bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Chester Beatty Inv. 63; 64; 65; 66 = P. Pintaudi 23
MacCoull Leslie S.B., Administering Dioscorus' Monastery: Evidence in Lists.
Diletta Minutoli (a cura di), Inediti offerti a Rosario Pintaudi per il suo 65° compleanno (P.Pintaudi) (Firenze, 2012) pp. 114-119 et pl. XXIV.

Lists of names followed by either a patronymic or a job title. Hypothetically linked by the editor to the Aphrodito region and to the monastery founded by the father of the sixth-century poet-lawyer Dioscorus of Aphrodito, Apollos. Antaiopolite, AD VII.
